compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Establish firewall and router configuration standards that include the following:  A formal process for approving and testing all network connections and changes to the firewall and router configurations

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Current network diagram with all connections to cardholder data; including any wireless networks.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Requirements for a firewall at each Internet connection and between any demilitarized zone (DMZ) and the internal network zone.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Description of groups; roles; and responsibilities for logical management of network components.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Documentation and business justification for use of all services; protocols; and ports allowed; including documentation of security features implemented for those protocols considered to be insecure.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Requirement to review firewall and router rule sets at least every six months.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Build firewall and router configurations that restrict connections between untrusted networks and any system components in the cardholder data environment.Restrict inbound and outbound traffic to that which is necessary for the cardholder data environment.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Secure and synchronize router configuration files.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Install perimeter firewalls between any wireless networks and the cardholder data environment; and configure these firewalls to deny or control (if such traffic is necessary for business purposes) any traffic from the wireless environment into the cardholder data environment.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Prohibit direct public access between the Internet and any system component in the cardholder data environment.                Implement a DMZ to limit inbound traffic to only system components that provide authorized publicly accessible services; protocols; and ports.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Limit inbound Internet traffic to IP addresses within the DMZ.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not allow any direct connections inbound or outbound for traffic between the Internet and the cardholder data environment.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not allow internal addresses to pass from the Internet into the DMZ.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not allow unauthorized outbound traffic from the cardholder data environment to the Internet.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Implement stateful inspection; also known as dynamic packet filtering. (That is; only -established- connections are allowed into the network.)

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Place system components that store cardholder data (such as a database) in an internal network zone; segregated from the DMZ and other untrusted networks.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not disclose private IP addresses and routing information to unauthorized parties.

compliance_package_name: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Install personal firewall software on any mobile and/or employee-owned computers with direct connectivity to the Internet (for example; laptops used by employees); which are used to access the organization’s network.

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Always change vendor-supplied defaults before installing a system on the network—including but not limited to passwords; simple network management protocol (SNMP) community strings; and elimination of unnecessary accounts.

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: For wireless environments connected to the cardholder data environment or transmitting cardholder data; change wireless vendor defaults; including but not limited to default wireless encryption keys; passwords; and SNMP community strings.

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Develop configuration standards for all system components. Assure that these standards address all known security vulnerabilities and are consistent with industry-accepted system hardening standards.
mitigation_controls_name: Laptops and Desktops Windows Standard Build -

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Implement only one primary function per server to prevent functions that require different security levels from co-existing on the same server. (For example; web servers; database servers; and DNS should be implemented on separate servers.) Note: Where virtualization technologies are in use; implement only one primary function per virtual system component.

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Enable only necessary and secure services; protocols; daemons; etc. as required for the function of the system. Implement security features for any required services; protocols or daemons that are considered to be insecure.

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Configure system security parameters to prevent misuse

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Remove all unnecessary functionality; such as scripts; drivers; features; subsystems; file systems; and unnecessary web servers.
mitigation_controls_name: Laptops and Desktops Windows Standard Build -

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Encrypt all non-console administrative access using strong cryptography. Use technologies such as SSH; VPN; or SSL/TLS for web-based management and other non-console administrative access.

compliance_package_name: Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
compliance_package_item_name: Shared hosting providers must protect each entity’s hosted environment and cardholder data. These providers must meet specific requirements as detailed in Appendix A: Additional PCI DSS Requirements for Shared Hosting Providers.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Keep cardholder data storage to a minimum by implementing data retention and disposal policies; procedures and processes as follows: Implement a data retention and disposal policy that includes: - Limiting data storage amount and retention time to that which is required for legal; regulatory; and business requirements.-  Processes for secure deletion of data when no longer needed.-  Specific retention requirements for cardholder data.-  A quarterly automatic or manual process for identifying and securely deleting stored cardholder data that exceeds defined retention requirements.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not store sensitive authentication data after authorization (even if encrypted). Sensitive authentication data includes the data as cited in the following Requirements through 3.2.3.  Note: It is permissible for issuers and companies that support issuing services to store sensitive authentication data if there is a business justification and the data is stored securely.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not store the full contents of any track from the magnetic stripe (located on the back of a card; equivalent data contained on a chip; or elsewhere). This data is alternatively called full track; track; track 1; track 2; and magnetic-stripe data.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not store the card-verification code or value (three-digit or four-digit number printed on the front or back of a payment card) used to verify card-not-present transactions.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Do not store the personal identification number (PIN) or the encrypted PIN block.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Mask PAN when displayed (the first six and last four digits are the maximum number of digits to be displayed).

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Render PAN unreadable anywhere it is stored (including on portable digital media; backup media; and in logs) by using any of the following approaches:    -  One-way hashes based on strong cryptography (hash must be of the entire PAN)   -  Truncation (hashing cannot be used to replace the truncated segment of PAN)   -  Index tokens and pads (pads must be securely stored)   -  Strong cryptography with associated key management processes and proceduresNote: It is a relatively trivial effort for a malicious individual to reconstruct original PAN data if they have access to both the truncated and hashed version of a PAN.  Where hashed and truncated versions of the same PAN are present in an entity's environment; additional controls should be in place to ensure that the hashed and truncated versions cannot be correlated to reconstruct the original PAN.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: If disk encryption is used (rather than file- or column-level database encryption); logical access must be managed independently of native operating system access control mechanisms (for example; by not using local user account databases). Decryption keys must not be tied to user accounts.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Protect any keys used to secure cardholder data against both disclosure and misuse:Note: This requirement also applies to key encryption keys used to protect data encrypting keys -- such key encryption keys must be at least as strong as the data encrypting key.Restrict access to cryptographic keys to the fewest number of custodians necessary.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Store cryptographic keys securely in the fewest possible locations and forms.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Fully document and implement all key management processes and procedures for cryptographic keys used for encryption of cardholder data; including the following:Generation of strong cryptographic keys.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Secure cryptographic key distribution.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Secure cryptographic key storage.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Cryptographic key changes for keys that have reached the end of their cryptoperiod (for example; after a defined period of time has passed and/or after a certain amount of cipher-text has been produced by a given  key); as defined by the associated application vendor or key owner; and based on industry best practices and guidelines (for example; NIST Special Publication 800-57).

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Retirement or replacement (for example; archiving; destruction; and/or revocation) of keys as deemed necessary when the integrity of the key has been weakened (for example; departure of an employee with knowledge of a clear-text key); or keys are suspected of being compromised.Note: If retired or replaced cryptographic keys need to be retained; these keys must be securely archived (for example; by using a key encryption key). Archived cryptographic keys should only be used for decryption/verification purposes.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: If manual clear-text cryptographic key management operations are used; these operations must be managed using split knowledge and dual control (for example; requiring two or three people; each knowing only their own key component; to reconstruct the whole key).Note: Examples of manual key management operations include; but are not limited to: key generation; transmission; loading; storage and destruction.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Prevention of unauthorized substitution of cryptographic keys.

compliance_package_name: Protect stored cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Requirement for cryptographic key custodians to formally acknowledge that they understand and accept their key-custodian responsibilities.

compliance_package_name: Encrypt transmission of cardholder data across open; public networks
compliance_package_item_name: Use strong cryptography and security protocols (for example; SSL/TLS; IPSEC; SSH; etc.) to safeguard sensitive cardholder data during transmission over open; public networks.

compliance_package_name: Encrypt transmission of cardholder data across open; public networks
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure wireless networks transmitting cardholder data or connected to the cardholder data environment;  use industry best practices ( e.g.; IEEE 802.11i) to implement strong encryption for authentication and transmission.Note: The use of WEP as a security control was prohibited as of 30 June; 2010.

compliance_package_name: Encrypt transmission of cardholder data across open; public networks
compliance_package_item_name: Never send unprotected PANs by end-user messaging technologies (for example; e-mail; instant messaging; chat; etc.).

compliance_package_name: Use and regularly update anti-virus software or programs
compliance_package_item_name: Deploy anti-virus software on all systems commonly affected by malicious software (particularly personal computers and servers).

compliance_package_name: Use and regularly update anti-virus software or programs
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure that all anti-virus programs are capable of detecting; removing; and protecting against all known types of malicious software.

compliance_package_name: Use and regularly update anti-virus software or programs
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure that all anti-virus mechanisms are current; actively running; and generating audit logs.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure that all system components and software are protected from known vulnerabilities by having the latest vendor-supplied security patches installed. Install critical security patches within one month of release.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Establish a process to identify and assign a risk ranking to newly discovered security vulnerabilities.Note: Risk rankings should be based on industry best practices. For example; criteria for ranking -High- risk vulnerabilities may include a CVSS base score of or above; and/or a vendor-supplied patch classified by the vendor as -critical;- and/or a vulnerability affecting a critical system component.Note: The ranking of vulnerabilities as defined in 6.2.a is considered a best practice until June 30; 2012; after which it becomes a requirement.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Develop software applications (internal and external; and including web-based administrative access to applications) in accordance with PCI DSS (for example; secure authentication and logging) and based on industry best practices. Incorporate information security throughout the software development life cycle. These processes must include the following:

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Removal of custom application accounts; user IDs; and passwords before applications become active or are released to customers.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Review of custom code prior to release to production or customers in order to identify any potential coding vulnerability.Note: This requirement for code reviews applies to all custom code (both internal and public-facing); as part of the system development lifecycle. Code reviews can be conducted by knowledgeable internal personnel or third parties. Web applications are also subject to additional controls; if they are public facing; to address ongoing threats and vulnerabilities after implementation; as defined at PCI DSS Requirement 6.6.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Follow change control processes and procedures for all changes to system components.  The processes must include the following:Separate development/test and production environments.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Separation of duties between development/test and production environments.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Production data (live PANs) are not used for testing or development.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Removal of test data and accounts before production systems become active.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Change control procedures for the implementation of security patches and software modifications. Procedures must include the following: Documentation of impact.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Documented change approval by authorized parties.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Functionality testing to verify that the change does not adversely impact the security of the system.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Back-out procedures.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Develop applications based on secure coding guidelines. Prevent common coding vulnerabilities in software development processes; to include the following: Note: The vulnerabilities listed at through were current with industry best practices when this version of PCI DSS was published. However; as industry best practices for vulnerability management are updated (for example; the OWASP Guide; SANS CWE Top 25; CERT Secure Coding; etc.); the current best practices must be used for these requirements.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Injection flaws; particularly SQL injection.  Also consider OS Command Injection; LDAP and XpPath injection flaws as well as other injection flaws.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Buffer overflow.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Insecure cryptographic storage.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Insecure communications.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Improper error handling.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: All -High- vulnerabilities identified in the vulnerability identification process (as defined in PCI DSS Requirement 6.2).Note: This requirement is considered a best practice until June 30; 2012; after which it becomes a requirement.

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Requirements through 6.5.9; below; apply to web applications and application interfaces (internal or external):Cross-site scripting (XSS).

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Improper Access Control (such as insecure direct object references; failure to restrict URL access; and directory traversal).

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: Cross-site request forgery (CRSF).

compliance_package_name: Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
compliance_package_item_name: For public-facing web applications; address new threats and vulnerabilities on an ongoing basis and ensure these applications are protected against known attacks by either of the following methods:-       Reviewing public-facing web applications via manual or automated application vulnerability security assessment tools or methods; at least annually and after any changes-       Installing a web-application firewall in front of public-facing web applications

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Limit access to system components and cardholder data to only those individuals whose job requires such access.  Access limitations must include the following:Restriction of access rights to privileged user IDs to least privileges necessary to perform job responsibilities

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Assignment of privileges is based on individual personnel’s job classification and function

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Requirement for a documented approval by authorized parties specifying required privileges.

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Implementation of an automated access control system.

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Establish an access control system for systems components with multiple users that restricts access based on a user’s need to know; and is set to “deny all- unless specifically allowed. This access control system must include the following: Coverage of all system components.

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Assignment of privileges to individuals based on job classification and function.

compliance_package_name: Restrict access to cardholder data by business need to know
compliance_package_item_name: Default “deny-all- setting.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Assign all users a unique username before allowing them to access system components or cardholder data.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: In addition to assigning a unique ID; employ at least one of the following methods to authenticate all users:-  Something you know; such as a password or passphrase-  Something you have; such as a token device or smart card-  Something you are; such as a biometric

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Incorporate two-factor authentication for remote access (network-level access originating from outside the network) to the network by employees; administrators; and third parties. (For example; remote authentication and dial-in service (RADIUS) with tokens; terminal access controller access control system (TACACS) with tokens; or other technologies that facilitate two-factor authentication.)Note: Two-factor authentication requires that two of the three authentication methods (see Req. for descriptions of authentication methods) be used for authentication. Using one factor twice (e.g. using two separate passwords) is not considered two-factor authentication.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Render all passwords unreadable during transmission and storage on all system components using strong cryptography.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure proper user identification and authentication management for non-consumer users and administrators on all system components as follows:Control addition; deletion; and modification of user IDs; credentials; and other identifier objects.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Verify user identity before performing password resets.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Set passwords for first-time use and resets to a unique value for each user and change immediately after the first use.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Immediately revoke access for any terminated users.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Remove/disable inactive user accounts at least every 90 days.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Enable accounts used by vendors for remote access only during the time period needed. Monitor vendor remote access accounts when in use.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Communicate authentication procedures and policies to all users who have access to cardholder data.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Do not use group; shared; or generic accounts and passwords; or other authentication methods.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Change user passwords at least every 90 days.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Require a minimum password length of at least seven characters.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Use passwords containing both numeric and alphabetic characters.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Do not allow an individual to submit a new password that is the same as any of the last four passwords he or she has used.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Limit repeated access attempts by locking out the user ID after not more than six attempts.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Set the lockout duration to a minimum of 30 minutes or until administrator enables the user ID.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: If a session has been idle for more than 15 minutes; require the user to re-authenticate to re-activate the terminal or session.

compliance_package_name: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
compliance_package_item_name: Authenticate all access to any database containing cardholder data. This includes access by applications; administrators; and all other users.Restrict user direct access or queries to databases to database administrators.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Use appropriate facility entry controls to limit and monitor physical access to systems in the cardholder data environment.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Use video cameras and/or access control mechanisms to monitor individual physical access to sensitive areas. Review collected data and correlate with other entries. Store for at least three months; unless otherwise restricted by law.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Restrict physical access to publicly accessible network jacks.For example; areas accessible to visitors should not have network ports enabled unless network access is specifically authorized.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Restrict physical access to wireless access points; gateways; handheld devices; networking/communications hardware; and telecommunications lines.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Develop procedures to easily distinguish between onsite personnel and visitors; especially in areas where cardholder data is accessible.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Make sure all visitors are handled as follows:Authorized before entering areas where cardholder data is processed or maintained.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Given a physical token (for example; a badge or access device) that expires and that identifies the visitors as not onsite personnel.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Asked to surrender the physical token before leaving the facility or at the date of expiration.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Use a visitor log to maintain a physical audit trail of visitor activity. Document the visitor’s name; the firm represented; and the onsite personnel authorizing physical access on the log.  Retain this log for a minimum of three months; unless otherwise restricted by law.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Store media back-ups in a secure location; preferably an off-site facility; such as an alternate or backup site; or a commercial storage facility. Review the location’s security at least annually.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Physically secure all media.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Maintain strict control over the internal or external distribution of any kind of media; including the following:

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Classify media so the sensitivity of the data can be determined.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Send the media by secured courier or other delivery method that can be accurately tracked.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure management approves any and all media that is moved from a secured area (especially when media is distributed to individuals).

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Maintain strict control over the storage and accessibility of media.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Properly maintain inventory logs of all media and conduct media inventories at least annually.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Destroy media when it is no longer needed for business or legal reasons as follows:9.1Shred; incinerate; or pulp hardcopy materials so that cardholder data cannot be reconstructed.

compliance_package_name: Restrict physical access to cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Render cardholder data on electronic media unrecoverable so that cardholder data cannot be reconstructed.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Establish a process for linking all access to system components (especially access done with administrative privileges such as root) to each individual user.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: Implement automated audit trails for all system components to reconstruct the following events:1All individual accesses to cardholder data.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: All actions taken by any individual with root or administrative privileges.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Access to all audit trails.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Invalid logical access attempts.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 15 Use of identification and authentication mechanisms.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Initialization of the audit logs.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Creation and deletion of system-level objects.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Record at least the following audit trail entries for all system components for each event:1User identification.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Type of event.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Date and time.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Success or failure indication.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Origination of event.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Identity or name of affected data; system component; or resource.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Using time synchronization technology; synchronize all critical system clocks and times and ensure that the following is implemented for acquiring; distributing; and storing time.1Critical systems have the correct and consistent time.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Time data is protected.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Time settings are received from industry-accepted time sources.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Secure audit trails so they cannot be altered.1Limit viewing of audit trails to those with a job-related need.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Protect audit trail files from unauthorized modifications.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Promptly back up audit trail files to a centralized log server or media that is difficult to alter.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Write logs for external-facing technologies onto a log server on the internal LAN.

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Use file integrity monitoring or change detection software on logs to ensure that existing log data cannot be changed without generating alerts (although new data being added should not cause an alert).

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Review logs for all system components at least daily. Log reviews must include those servers that perform security functions like intrusion detection system (IDS) and authentication; authorization; and accounting protocol (AAA) servers (for example; RADIUS).

compliance_package_name: Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
compliance_package_item_name: 1Retain audit trail history for at least one year; with a minimum of three months immediately available for analysis (for example; online; archived; or restorable from backup).

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Test for the presence of wireless access points and detect unauthorized wireless access points on a quarterly basis.Note: Methods that may be used in the process include; but are not limited to; wireless network scans; physical/logical inspections of system components and infrastructure; network access control NAC); or wireless IDS/IPS.Whichever methods are used; they must be sufficient to detect and identify any unauthorized devices.

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Run internal and external network vulnerability scans at least quarterly and after any significant change in the network (such as new system component installations; changes in network topology; firewall rule modifications; product upgrades).1Perform quarterly internal vulnerability scans.

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Perform quarterly external vulnerability scans via an Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) approved by the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council (PCI SSC).

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Perform internal and external scans after any significant change.

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Perform external and internal penetration testing at least once a year and after any significant infrastructure or application upgrade or modification (such as an operating system upgrade; a sub-network added to the environment; or a web server added to the environment). These penetration tests must include the following:1Network-layer penetration tests.

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Application-layer penetration tests.

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Use intrusion detection systems; and/or intrusion prevention systems to monitor all traffic at the perimeter of the cardholder data environment as well as at critical points inside of the cardholder data environment; and alert personnel to suspected compromises. Keep all intrusion detection and prevention engines; baselines; and signatures up-to-date.

compliance_package_name: Regularly test security systems and processes
compliance_package_item_name: 1Deploy file integrity monitoring tools to alert personnel to unauthorized modification of critical system files; configuration files or content files; and configure the software to perform critical file comparisons at least weekly.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: 1Establish; publish; maintain; and disseminate a security policy that accomplishes the following:

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: 1Addresses all PCI DSS requirements

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: 1Includes an annual process that identifies threats; and vulnerabilities; and results in a formal risk assessment.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: 1Includes a review at least annually and updates when the environment changes.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: 1Develop daily operational security procedures that are consistent with requirements in this specification (for example; user account maintenance procedures; and log review procedures).

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: 1Develop usage policies for critical technologies (for example; remote access technologies; wireless technologies; removable electronic media; laptops; tablets; personal data/digital assistants (PDAs); email usage and internet usage) and define proper use of these technologies. Ensure these usage policies require the following:1Explicit approval by authorized parties.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Authentication for use of the technology.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: A list of all such devices and personnel with access.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Labeling of devices to determine owner; contact information; and purpose.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Acceptable uses of the technology.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Acceptable network locations for the technologies.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: List of company-approved products.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Automatic disconnect of sessions for remote access technologies after a specific period of inactivity.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Activation of remote access technologies for vendors and business partners only when needed by vendors and business partners; with immediate deactivation after use.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: For personnel accessing cardholder data via remote access technologies; prohibit copy; move; and storage of cardholder data onto local hard drives and removable electronic media; unless explicitly authorized for a defined business need.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure that the security policy and procedures clearly define information security responsibilities for all personnel.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Assign to an individual or team the following information security management responsibilities:

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Establish; document; and distribute security policies and procedures.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Monitor and analyze security alerts and information; and distribute to appropriate personnel.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Establish; document; and distribute security incident response and escalation procedures to ensure timely and effective handling of all situations.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Administer user accounts; including additions; deletions; and modifications.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Monitor and control all access to data.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Implement a formal security awareness program to make all personnel aware of the importance of cardholder data security.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Educate personnel upon hire at least annually.Note:  Methods can vary depending on the role of the personnel and their level of access to the cardholder data.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Require personnel to acknowledge at least annually that they have read and understood the security policy and procedures.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Screen potential personnel prior to hire to minimize the risk of attacks from internal sources. (Examples of background checks include previous employment history; criminal record; credit history and reference checks.)Note:  For those potential personnel to be hired for certain positions such as store cashiers who only have access to one card number at a time when facilitating a transaction; this requirement is a recommendation only.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: If cardholder data is shared with service providers; maintain and implement policies and procedures to manage service providers; to include the following:1Maintain a list of service providers.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Maintain a written agreement that includes an acknowledgement that the service providers are responsible for the security of cardholder data the service providers possess.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Ensure there is an established process for engaging service providers including proper due diligence prior to engagement.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Maintain a program to monitor service providers’ PCI DSS compliance status at least annually.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Implement an incident response plan. Be prepared to respond immediately to a system breach.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Create the incident response plan to be implemented in the event of system breach.  Ensure the plan addresses the following; at a minimum:-  Roles; responsibilities and communication and contact strategies in the event of a compromise including notification of the payment brands; at a minimum-  Specific incident response procedures-  Business recovery and continuity procedures-  Data back-up processes-   Analysis of legal requirements for reporting compromises-  Coverage and responses of all critical system components-  Reference or inclusion of incident response procedures from the payment brands

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Test the plan at least annually.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Designate specific personnel to be available on a 24/7 basis to respond to alerts.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Provide appropriate training to staff with security breach response responsibilities.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Include alerts from intrusion detection; intrusion prevention; and file integrity monitoring systems.

compliance_package_name: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel
compliance_package_item_name: Develop a process to modify and evolve the incident response plan according to lessons learned and to incorporate industry developments.
